On November 18, 2015, Sutter announced that FX had cancelled the series after one season.\n', 'On May 22, 2015,"The Bastard Executioner" was picked up for a 10-episode series for fall launch.\n', 'BULLET::::- "The Bastard Executioner" (4 episodes; also executive producer)\n', 'In 2014, it was announced Sutter had begun developing "The Bastard Executioner", a new series for FX, The series was ordered to pilot on December 12, 2014. Katey Sagal, Lee Jones, and Stephen Moyer signed on to join the cast of the pilot. On May 22, 2015, the pilot was ordered to series with a 10-episode launch to premiere on September 15, 2015, on FX. The series was cancelled after one season.\n', 'BULLET::::- "The Bastard Executioner" (2015)\n', 'BULLET::::- 24 (stunt performer) (3 episodes, 2007)\n', 'BULLET::::- 15 seasons: 1965–1979\n', 'BULLET::::- "The Bastard Executioner"\n', 'Reviews for "The Bastard Executioner" were polarized, with praise being directed toward the action sequences, writing, and acting, and criticism toward the pacing, limited development, and excessive violence. It holds a rating of 49% (rotten) on the review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes based on 53 critics. The website\'s consensus reads: "Kurt Sutter\'s "The Bastard Executioner" doesn\'t want for dark thrills, but it unfortunately has more enthusiasm for brutality and gore than necessary narrative focus." Out of 37 reviews in Metacritic, the show holds a rating of 55.\n']

Based on this information, I can conclude that there is only **one season** of "The Bastard Executioner."

BULLET::::- "The Bastard Executioner"
Reviews for "The Bastard Executioner" were polarized, with praise being directed toward the action sequences, writing, and acting, and criticism toward the pacing, limited development, and excessive violence. It holds a rating of 49% (rotten) on the review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes based on 53 critics. The website's consensus reads: "Kurt Sutter's "The Bastard Executioner" doesn't want for dark thrills, but it unfortunately has more enthusiasm for brutality and gore than necessary narrative focus." Out of 37 reviews in Metacritic, the show holds a rating of 55.
